speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: SCENE III. Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Flourish. Enter KING, COUNTESS, LAFEU, the two French Lords, with Attendants

speaker: KING
text_entry: We lost a jewel of her; and our esteem

speaker: KING
text_entry: Was made much poorer by it: but your son,

speaker: KING
text_entry: As mad in folly, lack'd the sense to know

speaker: KING
text_entry: Her estimation home.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: 'Tis past, my liege;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: And I beseech your majesty to make it

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Natural rebellion, done i' the blaze of youth;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: When oil and fire, too strong for reason's force,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: O'erbears it and burns on.

speaker: KING
text_entry: My honour'd lady,

speaker: KING
text_entry: I have forgiven and forgotten all;

speaker: KING
text_entry: Though my revenges were high bent upon him,

speaker: KING
text_entry: And watch'd the time to shoot.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: This I must say,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: But first I beg my pardon, the young lord

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Did to his majesty, his mother and his lady

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Offence of mighty note; but to himself

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: The greatest wrong of all. He lost a wife

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Whose beauty did astonish the survey

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Of richest eyes, whose words all ears took captive,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Whose dear perfection hearts that scorn'd to serve

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Humbly call'd mistress.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Praising what is lost

speaker: KING
text_entry: Makes the remembrance dear. Well, call him hither;

speaker: KING
text_entry: We are reconciled, and the first view shall kill

speaker: KING
text_entry: All repetition: let him not ask our pardon;

speaker: KING
text_entry: The nature of his great offence is dead,

speaker: KING
text_entry: And deeper than oblivion we do bury

speaker: KING
text_entry: The incensing relics of it: let him approach,

speaker: KING
text_entry: A stranger, no offender; and inform him

speaker: KING
text_entry: So 'tis our will he should.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: I shall, my liege.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING
text_entry: What says he to your daughter? have you spoke?

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: All that he is hath reference to your highness.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Then shall we have a match. I have letters sent me

speaker: KING
text_entry: That set him high in fame.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Enter BERTRAM

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: He looks well on't.

speaker: KING
text_entry: I am not a day of season,

speaker: KING
text_entry: For thou mayst see a sunshine and a hail

speaker: KING
text_entry: In me at once: but to the brightest beams

speaker: KING
text_entry: Distracted clouds give way; so stand thou forth;

speaker: KING
text_entry: The time is fair again.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: My high-repented blames,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Dear sovereign, pardon to me.

speaker: KING
text_entry: All is whole;

speaker: KING
text_entry: Not one word more of the consumed time.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Let's take the instant by the forward top;

speaker: KING
text_entry: For we are old, and on our quick'st decrees

speaker: KING
text_entry: The inaudible and noiseless foot of Time

speaker: KING
text_entry: Steals ere we can effect them. You remember

speaker: KING
text_entry: The daughter of this lord?

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Admiringly, my liege, at first

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I stuck my choice upon her, ere my heart

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Durst make too bold a herald of my tongue

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Where the impression of mine eye infixing,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Contempt his scornful perspective did lend me,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Which warp'd the line of every other favour;

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Scorn'd a fair colour, or express'd it stolen;

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Extended or contracted all proportions

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: To a most hideous object: thence it came

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: That she whom all men praised and whom myself,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Since I have lost, have loved, was in mine eye

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: The dust that did offend it.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Well excused:

speaker: KING
text_entry: That thou didst love her, strikes some scores away

speaker: KING
text_entry: From the great compt: but love that comes too late,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Like a remorseful pardon slowly carried,

speaker: KING
text_entry: To the great sender turns a sour offence,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Crying, 'That's good that's gone.' Our rash faults

speaker: KING
text_entry: Make trivial price of serious things we have,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Not knowing them until we know their grave:

speaker: KING
text_entry: Oft our displeasures, to ourselves unjust,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Destroy our friends and after weep their dust

speaker: KING
text_entry: Our own love waking cries to see what's done,

speaker: KING
text_entry: While shame full late sleeps out the afternoon.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Be this sweet Helen's knell, and now forget her.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Send forth your amorous token for fair Maudlin:

speaker: KING
text_entry: The main consents are had; and here we'll stay

speaker: KING
text_entry: To see our widower's second marriage-day.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Which better than the first, O dear heaven, bless!

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Or, ere they meet, in me, O nature, cesse!

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Come on, my son, in whom my house's name

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Must be digested, give a favour from you

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: To sparkle in the spirits of my daughter,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: That she may quickly come.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: BERTRAM gives a ring

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: By my old beard,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: And every hair that's on't, Helen, that's dead,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Was a sweet creature: such a ring as this,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: The last that e'er I took her at court,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: I saw upon her finger.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Hers it was not.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Now, pray you, let me see it; for mine eye,

speaker: KING
text_entry: While I was speaking, oft was fasten'd to't.

speaker: KING
text_entry: This ring was mine; and, when I gave it Helen,

speaker: KING
text_entry: I bade her, if her fortunes ever stood

speaker: KING
text_entry: Necessitied to help, that by this token

speaker: KING
text_entry: I would relieve her. Had you that craft, to reave

speaker: KING
text_entry: her

speaker: KING
text_entry: Of what should stead her most?

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: My gracious sovereign,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Howe'er it pleases you to take it so,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: The ring was never hers.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Son, on my life,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: I have seen her wear it; and she reckon'd it

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: At her life's rate.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: I am sure I saw her wear it.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: You are deceived, my lord; she never saw it:

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: In Florence was it from a casement thrown me,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Wrapp'd in a paper, which contain'd the name

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Of her that threw it: noble she was, and thought

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I stood engaged: but when I had subscribed

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: To mine own fortune and inform'd her fully

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I could not answer in that course of honour

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: As she had made the overture, she ceased

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: In heavy satisfaction and would never

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Receive the ring again.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Plutus himself,

speaker: KING
text_entry: That knows the tinct and multiplying medicine,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Hath not in nature's mystery more science

speaker: KING
text_entry: Than I have in this ring: 'twas mine, 'twas Helen's,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Whoever gave it you. Then, if you know

speaker: KING
text_entry: That you are well acquainted with yourself,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Confess 'twas hers, and by what rough enforcement

speaker: KING
text_entry: You got it from her: she call'd the saints to surety

speaker: KING
text_entry: That she would never put it from her finger,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Unless she gave it to yourself in bed,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Where you have never come, or sent it us

speaker: KING
text_entry: Upon her great disaster.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: She never saw it.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Thou speak'st it falsely, as I love mine honour;

speaker: KING
text_entry: And makest conjectural fears to come into me

speaker: KING
text_entry: Which I would fain shut out. If it should prove

speaker: KING
text_entry: That thou art so inhuman,--'twill not prove so;--

speaker: KING
text_entry: And yet I know not: thou didst hate her deadly,

speaker: KING
text_entry: And she is dead; which nothing, but to close

speaker: KING
text_entry: Her eyes myself, could win me to believe,

speaker: KING
text_entry: More than to see this ring. Take him away.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Guards seize BERTRAM

speaker: KING
text_entry: My fore-past proofs, howe'er the matter fall,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Shall tax my fears of little vanity,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Having vainly fear'd too little. Away with him!

speaker: KING
text_entry: We'll sift this matter further.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: If you shall prove

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: This ring was ever hers, you shall as easy

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Prove that I husbanded her bed in Florence,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Where yet she never was.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Exit, guarded

speaker: KING
text_entry: I am wrapp'd in dismal thinkings.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Enter a Gentleman

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Gracious sovereign,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Whether I have been to blame or no, I know not:

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Here's a petition from a Florentine,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Who hath for four or five removes come short

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: To tender it herself. I undertook it,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Vanquish'd thereto by the fair grace and speech

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Of the poor suppliant, who by this I know

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Is here attending: her business looks in her

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: With an importing visage; and she told me,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: In a sweet verbal brief, it did concern

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Your highness with herself.

speaker: KING
text_entry: [Reads]  Upon his many protestations to marry me

speaker: KING
text_entry: when his wife was dead, I blush to say it, he won

speaker: KING
text_entry: me. Now is the Count Rousillon a widower: his vows

speaker: KING
text_entry: are forfeited to me, and my honour's paid to him. He

speaker: KING
text_entry: stole from Florence, taking no leave, and I follow

speaker: KING
text_entry: him to his country for justice: grant it me, O

speaker: KING
text_entry: king! in you it best lies; otherwise a seducer

speaker: KING
text_entry: flourishes, and a poor maid is undone.

speaker: KING
text_entry: DIANA CAPILET.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: I will buy me a son-in-law in a fair, and toll for

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: this: I'll none of him.

speaker: KING
text_entry: The heavens have thought well on thee Lafeu,

speaker: KING
text_entry: To bring forth this discovery. Seek these suitors:

speaker: KING
text_entry: Go speedily and bring again the count.

speaker: KING
text_entry: I am afeard the life of Helen, lady,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Was foully snatch'd.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Now, justice on the doers!

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Re-enter BERTRAM, guarded

speaker: KING
text_entry: I wonder, sir, sith wives are monsters to you,

speaker: KING
text_entry: And that you fly them as you swear them lordship,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Yet you desire to marry.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Enter Widow and DIANA

speaker: KING
text_entry: What woman's that?

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: I am, my lord, a wretched Florentine,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Derived from the ancient Capilet:

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: My suit, as I do understand, you know,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: And therefore know how far I may be pitied.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: I am her mother, sir, whose age and honour

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Both suffer under this complaint we bring,

speaker: Widow
text_entry: And both shall cease, without your remedy.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Come hither, count; do you know these women?

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: My lord, I neither can nor will deny

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: But that I know them: do they charge me further?

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Why do you look so strange upon your wife?

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: She's none of mine, my lord.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: If you shall marry,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: You give away this hand, and that is mine;

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: You give away heaven's vows, and those are mine;

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: You give away myself, which is known mine;

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: For I by vow am so embodied yours,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: That she which marries you must marry me,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Either both or none.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Your reputation comes too short for my daughter; you

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: are no husband for her.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: My lord, this is a fond and desperate creature,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Whom sometime I have laugh'd with: let your highness

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Lay a more noble thought upon mine honour

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Than for to think that I would sink it here.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Sir, for my thoughts, you have them ill to friend

speaker: KING
text_entry: Till your deeds gain them: fairer prove your honour

speaker: KING
text_entry: Than in my thought it lies.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Good my lord,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Ask him upon his oath, if he does think

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: He had not my virginity.

speaker: KING
text_entry: What say'st thou to her?

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: She's impudent, my lord,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: And was a common gamester to the camp.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: He does me wrong, my lord; if I were so,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: He might have bought me at a common price:

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Do not believe him. O, behold this ring,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Whose high respect and rich validity

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Did lack a parallel; yet for all that

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: He gave it to a commoner o' the camp,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: If I be one.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: He blushes, and 'tis it:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Of six preceding ancestors, that gem,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Conferr'd by testament to the sequent issue,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Hath it been owed and worn. This is his wife;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: That ring's a thousand proofs.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Methought you said

speaker: KING
text_entry: You saw one here in court could witness it.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: I did, my lord, but loath am to produce

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: So bad an instrument: his name's Parolles.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: I saw the man to-day, if man he be.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Find him, and bring him hither.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: What of him?

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: He's quoted for a most perfidious slave,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: With all the spots o' the world tax'd and debosh'd;

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Whose nature sickens but to speak a truth.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Am I or that or this for what he'll utter,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: That will speak any thing?

speaker: KING
text_entry: She hath that ring of yours.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I think she has: certain it is I liked her,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: And boarded her i' the wanton way of youth:

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: She knew her distance and did angle for me,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Madding my eagerness with her restraint,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: As all impediments in fancy's course

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Are motives of more fancy; and, in fine,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Her infinite cunning, with her modern grace,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Subdued me to her rate: she got the ring;

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: And I had that which any inferior might

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: At market-price have bought.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: I must be patient:

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: You, that have turn'd off a first so noble wife,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: May justly diet me. I pray you yet;

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Since you lack virtue, I will lose a husband;

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Send for your ring, I will return it home,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: And give me mine again.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I have it not.

speaker: KING
text_entry: What ring was yours, I pray you?

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Sir, much like

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: The same upon your finger.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Know you this ring? this ring was his of late.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: And this was it I gave him, being abed.

speaker: KING
text_entry: The story then goes false, you threw it him

speaker: KING
text_entry: Out of a casement.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: I have spoke the truth.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Enter PAROLLES

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: My lord, I do confess the ring was hers.

speaker: KING
text_entry: You boggle shrewdly, every feather stars you.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Is this the man you speak of?

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Ay, my lord.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Tell me, sirrah, but tell me true, I charge you,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Not fearing the displeasure of your master,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Which on your just proceeding I'll keep off,

speaker: KING
text_entry: By him and by this woman here what know you?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: So please your majesty, my master hath been an

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: honourable gentleman: tricks he hath had in him,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: which gentlemen have.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Come, come, to the purpose: did he love this woman?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Faith, sir, he did love her; but how?

speaker: KING
text_entry: How, I pray you?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: He did love her, sir, as a gentleman loves a woman.

speaker: KING
text_entry: How is that?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: He loved her, sir, and loved her not.

speaker: KING
text_entry: As thou art a knave, and no knave. What an

speaker: KING
text_entry: equivocal companion is this!

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: I am a poor man, and at your majesty's command.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: He's a good drum, my lord, but a naughty orator.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Do you know he promised me marriage?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Faith, I know more than I'll speak.

speaker: KING
text_entry: But wilt thou not speak all thou knowest?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Yes, so please your majesty. I did go between them,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: as I said; but more than that, he loved her: for

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: indeed he was mad for her, and talked of Satan and

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: of Limbo and of Furies and I know not what: yet I

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: was in that credit with them at that time that I

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: knew of their going to bed, and of other motions,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: as promising her marriage, and things which would

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: derive me ill will to speak of; therefore I will not

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: speak what I know.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Thou hast spoken all already, unless thou canst say

speaker: KING
text_entry: they are married: but thou art too fine in thy

speaker: KING
text_entry: evidence; therefore stand aside.

speaker: KING
text_entry: This ring, you say, was yours?

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Ay, my good lord.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Where did you buy it? or who gave it you?

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: It was not given me, nor I did not buy it.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Who lent it you?

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: It was not lent me neither.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Where did you find it, then?

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: I found it not.

speaker: KING
text_entry: If it were yours by none of all these ways,

speaker: KING
text_entry: How could you give it him?

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: I never gave it him.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: This woman's an easy glove, my lord; she goes off

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: and on at pleasure.

speaker: KING
text_entry: This ring was mine; I gave it his first wife.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: It might be yours or hers, for aught I know.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Take her away; I do not like her now;

speaker: KING
text_entry: To prison with her: and away with him.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Unless thou tell'st me where thou hadst this ring,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Thou diest within this hour.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: I'll never tell you.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Take her away.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: I'll put in bail, my liege.

speaker: KING
text_entry: I think thee now some common customer.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: By Jove, if ever I knew man, 'twas you.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Wherefore hast thou accused him all this while?

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Because he's guilty, and he is not guilty:

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: He knows I am no maid, and he'll swear to't;

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: I'll swear I am a maid, and he knows not.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Great king, I am no strumpet, by my life;

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: I am either maid, or else this old man's wife.

speaker: KING
text_entry: She does abuse our ears: to prison with her.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Good mother, fetch my bail. Stay, royal sir:

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Exit Widow

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: The jeweller that owes the ring is sent for,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: And he shall surety me. But for this lord,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Who hath abused me, as he knows himself,

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Though yet he never harm'd me, here I quit him:

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: He knows himself my bed he hath defiled;

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: And at that time he got his wife with child:

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Dead though she be, she feels her young one kick:

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: So there's my riddle: one that's dead is quick:

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: And now behold the meaning.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Re-enter Widow, with HELENA

speaker: KING
text_entry: Is there no exorcist

speaker: KING
text_entry: Beguiles the truer office of mine eyes?

speaker: KING
text_entry: Is't real that I see?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: No, my good lord;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: 'Tis but the shadow of a wife you see,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The name and not the thing.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Both, both. O, pardon!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: O my good lord, when I was like this maid,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I found you wondrous kind. There is your ring;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And, look you, here's your letter; this it says:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: 'When from my finger you can get this ring

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And are by me with child,'  and c. This is done:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Will you be mine, now you are doubly won?

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: If she, my liege, can make me know this clearly,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I'll love her dearly, ever, ever dearly.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: If it appear not plain and prove untrue,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Deadly divorce step between me and you!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: O my dear mother, do I see you living?

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Mine eyes smell onions; I shall weep anon:

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: To PAROLLES

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Good Tom Drum, lend me a handkercher: so,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: I thank thee: wait on me home, I'll make sport with thee:

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Let thy courtesies alone, they are scurvy ones.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Let us from point to point this story know,

speaker: KING
text_entry: To make the even truth in pleasure flow.

speaker: KING
text_entry: To DIANA

speaker: KING
text_entry: If thou be'st yet a fresh uncropped flower,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Choose thou thy husband, and I'll pay thy dower;

speaker: KING
text_entry: For I can guess that by thy honest aid

speaker: KING
text_entry: Thou keep'st a wife herself, thyself a maid.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Of that and all the progress, more or less,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Resolvedly more leisure shall express:

speaker: KING
text_entry: All yet seems well; and if it end so meet,

speaker: KING
text_entry: The bitter past, more welcome is the sweet.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Flourish

speaker: KING
text_entry: EPILOGUE

speaker: KING
text_entry: The king's a beggar, now the play is done:

speaker: KING
text_entry: All is well ended, if this suit be won,

speaker: KING
text_entry: That you express content; which we will pay,

speaker: KING
text_entry: With strife to please you, day exceeding day:

speaker: KING
text_entry: Ours be your patience then, and yours our parts;

speaker: KING
text_entry: Your gentle hands lend us, and take our hearts.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Exeunt
